repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.unittitle: John Y Brown, Sr. papers
did.abstract: The John Y. Brown Sr., Papers (dated 1915-1985, undated; 6.31 cubic feet; 10 boxes) comprise the correspondence, clippings, personal, printed, and political materials of John Y. Brown Sr.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into the following series: Appointment Accounting Books, Audio-Visual, Awards, Certificates, and Honors, Clippings, Constitutional Revision, Correspondence, Legal and Corporate Documents, Personal, Political Materials and Ephemera, Printed Materials, Speeches and Statements. The individual series, exluding the Personal series which is organized alphabetically by subject, are organized in chronological order.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Y. Brown Sr. was born in Geigers Lake, Union County, Ky. His parents, tenant farmers Jesse C. and Lucy K. Brown, named him after former Kentucky governor John Y. Brown. Brown attended Centre College in Danville, Ky., earning a bachelor of arts degree in 1921. He then attended the University of Kentucky, receiving a bachelor of laws degree in 1926. After graduating from the University of Kentucky, Brown was admitted to the bar and began practicing law in Lexington, Ky. In 1929, Brown married Dorothy Inman of Somerset, Ky. First elected to the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1930, Brown quickly rose to prominence within the Democratic party. He served as the Speaker of the Kentucky House of Reprsentatives in 1932. Brown was elected to the United States House of Representatives in a 1932 at-large election. Serving in the U.S. House from 1933-1935, Brown lost his bid for renomination in the 1934 Democratic primary. Brown would go on to make many unsuccessful bids for public office, including seven unsuccessful bids for United States Senator. He lost the 1939 Democratic gubernatorial primary to Keen Johnson, the 1946 United States Senate race to John Sherman Cooper, and the 1966 United States Senate race to John Sherman Cooper. However, Brown was elected to the Kentucky House of Representatives for six terms. He served as the majority floor leader during the General Assembly's 1966 session; this would be his last time holding an elected office.

When he was not holding political office, Brown practiced law and engaged in business ventures. He was a well respected and capable criminal trial lawyer. Brown fathered five children, Dorothy Ann, Betty Bruce, John Y. Jr., Diane, and Pamela Faris. His daughter Pamela died in 1970 while attempting to cross the Atlantic Ocean with her husband in a balloon. John Y. Brown Jr. was a successful businessman, owning professional basketball teams as well as Kentucky Fried Chicken. Brown Jr. would go on to lead a successful campaign for Governor of Kentucky in 1979, serving from 1979-1983. John Y. Brown Sr. is also the grandfather of former Kentucky Secretary of State John Y. Brown III and newscaster Pamela Ashley Brown. Brown succumbed to pneumonia on June 16, 1985, six months after an automobile accident paralyzed him from the waist down.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 1997ms102: [identification of item], John Y. Brown Sr., papers, 1915-1985, undated, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The John Y. Brown Sr., Papers (dated 1915-1985, undated; 6.31 cubic feet; 10 boxes) comprise the correspondence, clippings, personal, printed, and political materials of John Y. Brown Sr. Also includes photographs, appointment books, financial and business documents, speeches, and awards. The collection is organized into eleven series: Appointment and Accounting Books, Audio-Visual, Awards, Certificates, and Honors, Clippings, Constitutional Revision Correspondence, Legal and Corporate Documentation, Personal, Political Materials and Ephemera, Printed Materials, Speeches and Statements. The collection documents the personal, professional, and political life of John Y. Brown Sr.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

did.unittitle: Appointment and Accounting Books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Appointment and Accounting Books series comprises books in which the appointments and personal financial transactions of John Y. Brown Sr. were recorded. The series is organized in chronological order.

did.unittitle: Audio-Visual

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Audio-Visual series comprises audio recordings and photographs. The recordings sub-series contains audio recordings and is organized by chronological order. The photographs sub-series contains photographs of various contents and is organized in chronological order.

Awards, Certificates, and Honors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Awards, Certificates, and Honors series comprises awards and certificates given to John Y. Brown Sr. from various organizations both legal and charitable. The series is organized in chronological order.

Newspaper clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Newspaper clippings series comprises newspapers and newspaper clippings concerning the career of John Y. Brown, Sr. The series is primarily organized in chronological order, with the exception of clippings concerned with gubernatorial election of John Y. Brown Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Legal and Corporate Documentation series comprises correspondence, research, and legal documents from legal matters and cases in which John Y. Brown Sr. was involved. The series is organized in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The personal series comprises materials related to members of the Brown family, personal financial documents, recollections of legal experiences, among other personal materials. The series is organized alphabetically by subject.

Political Materials and Ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Political Materials and Ephemera series comprises materials from the campaigns of John Y. Brown Sr., John Y. Brown Jr., and other candidates. The series also contains materials from John Y. Brown Sr.'s time as a state representative. The series is organized by chronological order.

Printed Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Printed Materials series comprises articles, books, reports, and journal articles. The Communism sub-series contains printed materials relating to the aims and spread of communism. The Kentucky Government sub-series contains printed materials related to the history and function of government in Kentucky. The series is organized in chronological order.
